feed.title: SAP Community - SAP ERP
feed.subtitle: SAP ERP Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Help needed with BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE to post finished product receipt (subcontracting scenario)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
I'm looking for help implementing a BAPI to post the receipt of a finished product from a vendor, referencing a subcontracting purchase order.

👉 The scenario is as follows:

  • A 101 movement needs to be posted to receive the finished product.

  • At the same time, the components provided to the vendor must be consumed using a 543 movement, since the product has a BOM (bill of materials).

  • Both the receipt and the consumption should be recorded in the same operation.

I'm using the BAPI BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE, and although it returns no error messages, it also does not generate a material document.
I've already verified that all required data is complete and that the COMMIT WORK is being executed correctly.

Below is the code I’m currently using:  

FORM f_execute_bapi USING p_error TYPE flag.

CHECK p_error IS INITIAL.

DATA: ls_header TYPE bapi2017_gm_head_01,
lt_items TYPE TABLE OF bapi2017_gm_item_create,
ls_item TYPE bapi2017_gm_item_create,
ls_code TYPE bapi2017_gm_code,
lt_return TYPE bapiret2_tab,
lv_goodsmvt_headret TYPE bapi2017_gm_head_ret,
lv_mat_doc TYPE bapi2017_gm_head_ret-mat_doc,
lv_doc_year TYPE bapi2017_gm_head_ret-doc_year,
ls_componentes TYPE ty_componentes,
lv_movimiento TYPE bwart VALUE '543',
lv_gm_code TYPE gm_code VALUE '01',
ls_lote_stock TYPE ty_lote_stock,
l_aux_mat TYPE mara-matnr,
lv_line_id TYPE mb_line_id VALUE '000001'.

CLEAR ls_header.
ls_header-pstng_date = gs_0100-fecha_cont.
ls_header-doc_date = gs_0100-fecha_doc.
ls_header-header_txt = gs_0100-bktxt.
ls_code-gm_code = lv_gm_code.

REFRESH lt_items[].

LOOP AT gt_items INTO gs_items.
CLEAR: ls_item, l_aux_mat.

CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_MATN1_INPUT'
EXPORTING input = gs_items-matnr
IMPORTING output = l_aux_mat.

ls_item-material = l_aux_mat.
ls_item-plant = gs_items-werks.
ls_item-stge_loc = gs_items-lgort.
ls_item-move_type = '101'.
ls_item-mvt_ind = 'B'.
ls_item-batch = gs_items-charg.
ls_item-entry_qnt = gs_items-menge.
ls_item-po_number = gs_items-ebeln.
ls_item-po_item = gs_0100-po_item.
ls_item-parent_id = '000001'.
ls_item-line_id = lv_line_id.

CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_CUNIT_INPUT'
EXPORTING input = gs_items-meins_ne
IMPORTING output = ls_item-entry_uom.

APPEND ls_item TO lt_items.
ENDLOOP.

IF gt_items[] IS NOT INITIAL.
READ TABLE gt_items INTO DATA(ls_items) INDEX 1.
ENDIF.

lv_line_id = '0000002'.
LOOP AT gt_componentes INTO ls_componentes.
CLEAR ls_item.

ls_item-material = ls_componentes-matnr.
ls_item-plant = ls_componentes-werks.
ls_item-stge_loc = ls_componentes-lgort.

LOOP AT gt_lote_stock INTO ls_lote_stock
WHERE matnr = ls_componentes-matnr
AND cantidad >= ls_componentes-menge.
ls_item-batch = ls_lote_stock-charg.
EXIT.
ENDLOOP.

ls_item-batch = ls_componentes-charg.
ls_item-move_type = lv_movimiento.
ls_item-entry_qnt = ls_componentes-menge.

CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_CUNIT_INPUT'
EXPORTING input = ls_componentes-meins_un
IMPORTING output = ls_item-entry_uom.

ls_item-po_number = gs_0100-po_number.
ls_item-po_item = gs_0100-po_item.
ls_item-spec_stock = 'O'.
ls_item-line_id = lv_line_id.
lv_line_id = lv_line_id + 1.
ls_item-parent_id = '000001'.
ls_item-mvt_ind = 'O'.
ls_item-vendor = ls_componentes-lifnr.

APPEND ls_item TO lt_items.
ENDLOOP.

REFRESH lt_return[].

BREAK sabap.
BREAK soporte_p.

CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_GOODSMVT_CREATE'
EXPORTING
goodsmvt_header = ls_header
goodsmvt_code = ls_code
IMPORTING
goodsmvt_headret = lv_goodsmvt_headret
materialdocument = lv_mat_doc
matdocumentyear = lv_doc_year
TABLES
goodsmvt_item = lt_items
return = lt_return.

APPEND LINES OF lt_return[] TO gt_mensajes[].

READ TABLE lt_return TRANSPORTING NO FIELDS WITH KEY type = 'E'.
IF sy-subrc NE 0.
CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT' EXPORTING wait = 'X'.
ELSE.
ROLLBACK WORK.
ENDIF.

Below I’m also including the contents of the variables used in the BAPI, in case it helps to better understand the context:

LT_ITEMS

 

LS_HEADER

LS_CODE 

Result:

Sy-subrc = 0

lt_return = 

Best Regards,

entry.title: Translation of SAP terminology glossary
entry.content: Hi, we are rolling out our SAP system to Southeast Asian countries. I am looking for an SAP terminology glossary that provides translations between English and multiple languages to assist in the preparation of TTT (Train-the-Trainer) documentation. Could you please advise where I can find such information?

entry.content:
hello

we are doing a conversion to S4Hana and in the CVI activities, we are running CVI_LEDH.

there are about 5000 customers/vendors that need harmonization but we already know that most addresses must be set to customer as well as for tax and leading bank to Vendor.

is there a way to mass set the object? it would be very time consuming to do this manually one by one

thanks for the reply

Alisa

entry.title: Dissertation Research – Insights from SAP Supply Chain Professionals Needed
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I’m a postgraduate student in Msc in Procurement and Supply chain management from Griffith college Dublin, researching how digital tools like SAP impact supply chain operations. My dissertation focuses on how SAP influences cost control, decision-making, and efficiency across different industries.

I’ve developed a short academic survey (approx. 5–7 minutes) to collect insights from professionals who work with SAP or in supply chain roles.

👉 https://forms.office.com/e/YPXZ6ArcwD 

All responses are anonymous and used solely for academic research. I would be incredibly grateful for any input or feedback you can provide. Please feel free to share with others in your network who might be able to contribute.

Here is my email id: bhavya.alahari@student.griffith.ie  please feel free to ping me if there are any queries further or interested in knowing the results.

Thank you in advance for your support!

Feban

entry.title: Logic For Item in Grouping
entry.content:
I’ve been assigned to modify a program where the requirement is to display Profit Center and its corresponding Profit Center Name, under specific conditions.

Business Rule:

Group the data by FI Document Number (BELNR) first, then apply logic to retrieve the correct Profit Center Name based on the Profit Center values within the same document group.

Scenarios:

Case 1:
If all Profit Centers in the group share the same first 4 digits, strip the remaining digits of trailing zeros and use that to retrieve the Profit Center Name.

Case 2:
If the Profit Centers share the same first 2 digits, strip the rest of the digits of trailing zeros and retrieve the Profit Center Name.

Case 3:
If the Profit Centers are completely identical, then directly retrieve the Profit Center Name using that value.

Issue I’m Facing:

Right now, the program logic is executed per line item, which means it cannot determine if Profit Centers within the same FI Document group are similar or different. Therefore, it's difficult to apply the rules above correctly at the group level.

I would appreciate any suggestions or advice on how best to restructure or enhance the logic — especially how to compare Profit Center values across grouped FI Documents in ABAP, or whether you’ve handled a similar requirement before.

Thank you in advance 🙏

entry.title: How to know SAP license usage of my company?
entry.content:
Hi Experts 

In our company, we have procured 155 SAP licenses.  We have installed SAP ECC and S/4HANA (155 licenses ). 

Now I want to get a report about the remaining license count and usage of the existing licenses. 

Please advise.

BR 

Indka

entry.title: Business Partner details from CAMT EBS statements not correctly filled for Returns
entry.content:
Question about payment returns in CAMT Electronic Bank Statements. 


Our problem is that Business Partner details from CAMT statements filled with our own data, not data for real Business Partner. The root cause is that in SAP Standard transformation FIEB_CAMT053_V8_TO_FEB for these fields for Credit transaction (CdtDbtInd = CRDT) are filled from Debtor fields (Section: NtryDtls/TxDtls/RltdAgts/DbtrAgt). For payments it works correct. But for returns, our banks sends us statements with CdtDbtInd = CRDT and Business Partner information in Creditor fields (Section: NtryDtls/TxDtls/RltdAgts/CdtrAgt). So, one of these two (either SAP or our Bank) treats it not right. I'm trying to understand who? Would be appreciated for your advices, about how correctly it should be filled (in Debtor or Creditor section)? Is there any guidance in CAMT format description for specific processes (like returns)?

entry.title: Handling units with MTO: Sales order to be filled automatically MFHU
entry.content:
Hello guys, 

I want to configure the MTO scenario using Repetitve manufacturing and Handling units. I can create the HU in MFP1 and connect it to the sales order, te correct apcking instruction is determined. 

If I want to backflush the HU in MFHU, the field sales order is not automatically filled, I have to fill it again manually. 

Can you support me if I need to configure anything in the customizing so the sales order is automatically filled in MFHU backflush? 

 

Thanks

Felix

entry.title: Seeking Guidance on Growing
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I hope you're doing well. I recently graduated and have been working as a Data Migration Consultant for the past four months. I'm excited to be part of the SAP ecosystem and eager to learn and grow.

Looking ahead, I want to build a strong career and see myself at a higher professional level in the coming years. Since many of you have more experience in this field, I would really appreciate your advice.

  • What skills or certifications should I focus on?
  • Are there specific tools, modules, or projects I should try to get involved with?
  • How can I develop both technically and professionally in this role?

Any tips, resources, or personal experiences would be very helpful. Thank you in advance for your support

entry.title: Trading Partner within MM Subcontracting Consumption posting
entry.content:
Hello,

we face an issue in MM Subcontracting with an intercompany vendor. We use MM Subcontracting for a type of repair service. We send the broken item with a delivery related to a subcontracting purchase order, the item in the order is the same material number. When we receive the item back, the GR Posting also posts the consumption of the item sent (special stock in sending company) with trading partner. But this item is never owned by the IC vendor. Because of the system behaviour we get in trouble with our consolidation team, since this entry can not be consolidated with the IC vendor, so its a one side trading partner entry.

The propsal of SAP support is an implicit enhancement which we would like to avoid.

Has anybody a standard solution for this topic or maybe a process which does not cause such an issue?

Many thanks in advance!

Regards, Marion
